message_1: Let's say we have the number 19. Find all the quadratic residues modulo 19.
message_2:
A quadratic residue modulo n is an integer that is congruent to a perfect square modulo n. To find all the quadratic residues modulo 19, we will calculate the squares of the numbers from 1 to 9 (half of 19, rounded down) and then reduce them modulo 19.

1. 1² = 1 ≡ 1 (mod 19)
2. 2² = 4 ≡ 4 (mod 19)
3. 3² = 9 ≡ 9 (mod 19)
4. 4² = 16 ≡ 16 (mod 19)
5. 5² = 25 ≡ 6 (mod 19)
6. 6² = 36 ≡ 17 (mod 19)
7. 7² = 49 ≡ 11 (mod 19)
8. 8² = 64 ≡ 7 (mod 19)
9. 9² = 81 ≡ 5 (mod 19)

So, the quadratic residues modulo 19 are {1, 4, 9, 16, 6, 17, 11, 7, 5}.
